author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: 'Scare Me' 5K takes off Oct. 31
text:
'Scare Me' 5K takes off Oct. 31 By Staff | Oct 15, 2015 
Rockland — The "Scare Me" 5-Kilometer Road Race is scheduled to take off on Saturday, Oct. 31 at 10 a.m. at The Eclipse on 2 Park Drive. 
The event is another in a series of races coordinated in the Midcoast for Go! Malawi, a non-profit that raises funds for school tuition and provides education for orphans and other vulnerable children from Malawi, Africa. 
It is the final race of the series and is held on Halloween. Participants are encouraged to dress up for their trek around the city's streets. 
Registration is 8:30 to 10 a.m. One can preregister at RunSignUp.com or Active.com or via go-malawi.org . 
This race has prizes, giveaways and a unique prize for the best costume. Walkers, runners and well-behaved dogs are welcome to join in the event and costumes are encouraged. 
The annual 5K race series is organized by volunteers from Team Go! Malawi. This team consists of walkers and runners who share a common vision: “To Run With a Purpose, For a Purpose.” 
For more information, email Janet Littlefield, originally of Union and the director of Go! Malawi, at Janet@go-malawi.org. Courier Publications' sports staff can be reached by email at sports@villagesoup.com or by phone at 594-4401.
